variants.Description in input context: G2019S variant associated with increased kinase activity
R1441C variant linked to altered protein interactions

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids encoding wild-type or mutant LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased phosphorylation of downstream targets (e.g., Rab10) in cells expressing G2019S compared to wild-type.
Reduced interaction with PINK1 in R1441C-expressing cells, but no significant change in kinase activity.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 15% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels exceeding 30% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were stably transfected with LRRK2 variants and used for co-immunoprecipitation experiments.

Readout description.Result Description: Enhanced interaction with 14-3-3 proteins in G2019S-expressing cells.
Reduced binding to PINK1 in R1441C-expressing cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Two independent biological replicates were performed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without LRRK2 overexpression served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Interaction intensity within 20% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Interaction intensity deviating by more than 30% from wild-type levels.

Material used.Material Name: Patient-derived iPSC neurons with LRRK2 variants
Material used.Description: iPSC-derived neurons from Parkinson's patients carrying LRRK2 variants were used for viability assays.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant reduction in neuronal viability (50% decrease) in G2019S-expressing neurons compared to controls.
Moderate reduction in viability (30% decrease) in R1441C-expressing neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type iPSC neurons served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated control neurons served as negative controls.
